Disallow reassigningfunctiondeclarations

Table of ContentsRule DetailsHandled by TypeScriptVersionResources
JavaScript functions can be written as a FunctionDeclarationfunction foo() { ... }or as a FunctionExpressionconst foo = function() { ... };. While a JavaScript interpreter might tolerate it, overwriting/reassigning a function written as a FunctionDeclaration is often indicative of a mistake or issue.
functionfoo(){}foo=bar;12Copy code to clipboard
